result.markdown:
--- title: "Tips Dataset" author: "Musie Beyene" date: "2024-11-14" categories: [analysis] image: "image.jpg" --- This is a post on the tips dataset. This dataset is a record of ::: {#595e9bd0 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import seaborn as sns df_tips = sns.load_dataset("tips") df_tips.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8} ```{=html}
total_bill tip sex smoker day time size
0 16.99 1.01 Female No Sun Dinner 2
1 10.34 1.66 Male No Sun Dinner 3
2 21.01 3.50 Male No Sun Dinner 3
3 23.68 3.31 Male No Sun Dinner 2
4 24.59 3.61 Female No Sun Dinner 4
``` ::: ::: Let us plot visit counts by days of the week. ::: {#132d9e0d .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} plt.style.use("bmh") plt.title("Visit Counts by Day of the Week") sns.countplot(x="day", data=df_tips) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-3-output-1.png){width=583 height=450} ::: ::: We can also examine the distribution of visit counts by day of the week and sex. ::: {#a17b460a .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} plt.title("Visit Counts by Day of the Week") sns.countplot(x="day", hue="sex", data=df_tips); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-4-output-1.png){width=583 height=450} ::: ::: ## Distribution of spending by gender ::: {#f5035c55 .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} plt.title("Distribution of Spending by Gender") sns.histplot(x="total_bill", hue="sex", data=df_tips, fill=True); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-5-output-1.png){width=583 height=451} ::: ::: ## Distribution of spending by smoking status ::: {#f770e901 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} plt.title("Distribution of Spending by Smoking Status") sns.kdeplot(x="total_bill", hue="smoker", data=df_tips, fill=True); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-6-output-1.png){width=604 height=451} ::: ::: ## Distribution of spending by day ::: {#8e87820b .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} plt.title("Distribution of Spending by Day") sns.histplot(x="total_bill", hue="day", data=df_tips, fill=True); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-7-output-1.png){width=583 height=451} ::: ::: We can also include boxplots. ::: {#86477d61 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} plt.title("Distribution of Spending by Day") sns.boxplot(x="day", y="total_bill", data=df_tips); ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-8-output-1.png){width=583 height=450} ::: :::
